page.title: 04NODWELL FARM, TOTLAND
page.content: Mr. Morgan bought Nodewell farm in 1952, 33 years ago. He has 280 arces of ground, most of it pasture and rents some pasture on Tennyson downs. He has got 650 sheep, that costs Â£40 each. The Ovidip costs Â£50 a tin. Ovidip is a sheeps bath water. Mr. Morgan uses 4 tins of Ovidip that costs Â£200. He has beef cows and at the moment he has got 26 cattle and 23 calves and 1 french bull. The animals are bred on the farm. Mr. Morgan has 150 chickens that lay 3 to 4 dozen eggs a day. Mr. Morgan then sells most of the eggs. The chickens are free range. Mr. Morgan feeds the animals on hay, crushed oats and barley.
